news_header: Lloyds triples provisions for car finance mis-selling to £1.2bn, impacting profits amid compensation concerns.
news_original_title: Lloyds earmarks £1.2bn for car finance scandal
news_text: Lloyds Banking Group has increased its provisions for the car finance mis-selling scandal to £1.2 billion, affecting its profits. The bank is setting aside an additional £700 million for potential compensation, following a previous £450 million allocation. CEO Charlie Nunn stated that the current issues are not comparable to the PPI mis-selling scandal. The bank reported a pre-tax profit of £5.97 billion, down from £7.5 billion the previous year. The Supreme Court will soon rule on whether car loan customers were adequately informed about commission payments.
